title: The Secret Wish List
author: Preeti Shenoy
description: This novel tells the story of Diksha, a woman trapped in an unhappy marriage who rediscovers herself and her desires when she creates a wish list of things she wants to do, leading her to unexpected adventures and self-discovery.

title: The Rozabal Line
author: Ashwin Sanghi
description: This theological thriller explores the theory that Jesus survived the crucifixion and traveled to India, where he lived out his remaining years. The novel connects ancient history with contemporary events through a global conspiracy.

title: I Too Had a Love Story
author: Ravinder Singh
description: This autobiographical novel recounts the author's own love story, which began with an online encounter through a matrimonial website and ended tragically just days before the wedding, exploring love, loss, and grief.

title: Half Girlfriend
author: Chetan Bhagat
description: This romance novel follows the relationship between Madhav, a rural boy from Bihar who struggles with English, and Riya, an upper-class Delhi girl, exploring the dynamics of class, language, and cultural barriers in contemporary India.

title: Godan
author: Premchand
description: This classic Hindi novel depicts the life of Hori, a poor peasant, and his desire to own a cow, which is considered sacred in Hindu culture. It provides a realistic portrayal of rural India and the exploitation of peasants by landlords.

title: Chanakya's Chant
author: Ashwin Sanghi
description: This novel interweaves two parallel talesâ€”one of Chanakya, the shrewd strategist from ancient India, and the other of Gangasagar Mishra, a modern-day political kingmaker, exploring the timeless nature of politics and power.

title: Five Point Someone
author: Chetan Bhagat
description: This coming-of-age novel follows three friends at the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) who struggle with their grades, the education system, and personal relationships, questioning the conventional measures of success.

title: Em and the Big Hoom
author: Jerry Pinto
description: This semi-autobiographical novel explores the impact of mental illness on a family through the story of Imelda (Em), who suffers from bipolar disorder, and how her husband and children cope with her condition in their small Bombay apartment.

title: The Oath of the Vayuputras
author: Amish Tripathi
description: The final book in the Shiva Trilogy, this novel concludes the tale of Shiva's battle against evil as he leads his forces against the Chandravanshi Empire and confronts the true nature of good and evil in ancient India.

title: The Secret of the Nagas
author: Amish Tripathi
description: The second book in the Shiva Trilogy, this novel continues Shiva's quest to destroy the Nagas, mysterious serpent people believed to be evil, only to discover unexpected truths that challenge his understanding of good and evil.

title: In Custody
author: Anita Desai
description: This novel follows Deven, a Hindi lecturer who is given the opportunity to interview a famous Urdu poet, Nur. Through this encounter, the novel explores the dying tradition of Urdu poetry in post-independence India.

title: The Algebra of Infinite Justice
author: Arundhati Roy
description: This collection of essays covers a range of political topics, including India's nuclear tests, globalization, the US war on terror, and corporate globalization, offering a critique of contemporary power structures and their impact on ordinary people.

title: The Collector's Wife
author: Mitra Phukan
description: Set in Assam during the insurgency of the 1970s and 1980s, this novel follows Rukmini, the wife of a district collector, whose life is transformed by political violence and her own personal awakening in a small town on the edge of conflict.

title: 2 States: The Story of My Marriage
author: Chetan Bhagat
description: Based on the author's own experience, this novel tells the story of a couple from different states in India who face cultural and familial obstacles to their marriage, highlighting the regional diversity and prejudices within the country.

title: The Discovery of India
author: Jawaharlal Nehru
description: Written during Nehru's imprisonment in 1942-46, this book traces India's history from ancient times to independence, providing insights into the country's rich cultural heritage, philosophical traditions, and political evolution.

title: Ancient Promises
author: Jaishree Misra
description: This novel follows Janaki, who enters an arranged marriage in Kerala only to find herself trapped in an unhappy relationship. Years later, she reconnects with her first love, forcing her to choose between duty and personal happiness.

title: Curfewed Night
author: Basharat Peer
description: This memoir provides a first-person account of growing up in Kashmir during the insurgency of the 1990s, offering insights into the human cost of the conflict and the resilience of ordinary Kashmiris amidst violence and uncertainty.

title: Sea of Poppies
author: Amitav Ghosh
description: The first book in the Ibis Trilogy, this historical novel is set just before the First Opium War and follows diverse characters, including a widow, a raja, and a French orphan, whose lives intersect aboard the Ibis, a former slave ship.

title: The Legends of Khasak
author: O.V. Vijayan
description: This landmark Malayalam novel, translated into English, follows Ravi, who takes a teaching job in the remote village of Khasak to escape his troubled past, only to find himself drawn into the village's mystical world and complex social dynamics.

title: The Great Indian Novel
author: Shashi Tharoor
description: This satirical novel recasts the story of the Indian independence movement and its aftermath using characters and situations from the ancient Indian epic, the Mahabharata, creating a humorous and thought-provoking allegory.

title: One Night @ the Call Center
author: Chetan Bhagat
description: Set in a call center in Gurgaon, this novel follows six coworkers over the course of one night when they receive a phone call that changes their lives. It explores issues of outsourcing, relationships, and personal ambition in modern India.

title: The Palace of Illusions
author: Chitra Banerjee Divakaruni
description: A reimagining of the ancient Indian epic Mahabharata from the perspective of Panchaali, the wife of the five Pandava brothers, giving voice to this female character in a traditionally male-centered story.

title: Such a Long Journey
author: Rohinton Mistry
description: Set in Bombay during the 1971 India-Pakistan war, this novel follows Gustad Noble, a bank clerk whose ordered life is disrupted when he becomes unwittingly involved in a money-laundering scheme with political implications.

title: Siddhartha
author: Hermann Hesse
description: Set in India, this novel follows the spiritual journey of Siddhartha, a young Brahmin who leaves behind his comfortable life to seek enlightenment, encountering various philosophical and spiritual teachings along the way.

title: India After Gandhi: The History of the World's Largest Democracy
author: Ramachandra Guha
description: This comprehensive historical work examines the social, political, and economic development of India since its independence in 1947, analyzing the challenges and achievements of the world's largest democracy.
